chapter.title: Generating Quotes
chapter.para: Sometimes you will have Customers who come to your store looking for an Item, but for whatever reason they are unable to purchase it at that time. They may be shopping around comparing prices—or your store might be out of stock. Whatever the reason may be, you can still capture the potential Sale and provide the Customer with a price Quote. This Quote can then be converted to a Sale at a later date. The following topics will be discussed in this chapter:

listitem.para: Creating Quotes
Searching for Quotes
Converting Quotes to Sales
Deleting Quotes

section.title: Creating Quotes
section.para: Creating Quotes is very similar to creating Sales. They both use the Retail Sale screen. However, the difference is they use different Sale Types. To create a Quote, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Open the Retail Sale screen using the NEW button on the Cash Register screen
In the "Number" field, the next available number is entered automatically

note.para: Sales, Quotes, and Returns all share the same numbering system. The number is a unique identifier used to identify the particular transaction.

listitem.para: From the "Type" field, select the "Quote" option
Select the NEW button to enter Customer information—or, for repeat Customers, use the Customer lookup button [...]

note.para: Capturing Customer information can be useful for marketing (and other) purposes. However, you can configure xTuple POS to not require Customer information at the point of sale. If no Customer information is required, then the "Customer" tab on the Retail Sale screen will be hidden.

section.para: Quote Items are entered in the same way as Sale Items. To begin entering Quote Items, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the "Items" tab
Select the ADD button
Specify a Quote Item in the "Item Number" field
Then enter the quantity being quoted

note.para: Item Pricing is configured using xTuple ERP. For more information on Item Pricing, please consult the xTuple ERP Reference Guide.

tip.para: You can add Quote Items to a Quote using the following methods:

listitem.para: Scanning Item bar codes
Typing Item Numbers in manually,
Locating products using the Item lookup button [...]

section.para: To enter Quote details, select the "Details" tab. This tab includes additional information you may need to collect regarding the Quote—including the name of the sales associate who processed the Quote and any miscellaneous notes you may want to record.

note.para: A Sales Rep is required to successfully complete a Quote. If you cannot complete a Quote (e.g., cannot select the SAVE button), this may mean you have not specified a Sales Rep on the Quote "Detail" screen.

section.para: The system can be configured to automatically make the logged-in user the Sales Rep for a Quote. This configuration is discussed in more detail in the xTuple ERP Reference Guide. However, the following points provide an overview of the process:

listitem.para: Locate Employee records following this path: System > Employees
Create Employee records for your system users
On Employee records, specify Employees are Sales Reps
Create Sales Rep records for Employees
Now when users log in, they will be recognized as a Sales Reps

section.title: Searching for Quotes
section.para: If a Customer returns at a later date to purchase an Item based on a Quote you provided earlier, sales associates should have no trouble locating that information using xTuple POS. Follow these steps to search for Quotes:

listitem.para: Start on the Cash Register screen
Select the SEARCH button to open the Retail Sale Search screen
From the "Show" section, select the "Quotes" option
Specify a date range to include the Quote's created date
Optionally, enter keywords to limit the search. For example, if you know the Quote number was 100010, you could enter "100010" in the "Search" field.
Select the QUERY button to run the search
View the results, as shown in the following screen:

note.para: You can also perform Sales searches from the main Retail menu. However, any results from searches performed from the main menu are view-only. To convert Quotes to Sales, you must use the SEARCH button on the Cash Register screen.

section.para: Once you have found the Quote you want, simply highlight it and select the EDIT button—or double-click on the Quote to open it.

section.title: Converting Quotes to Sales
section.para: The process of converting a Quote to a Sale couldn't be easier. Once you have found the Quote using the Retail Sale Search, simply open the Quote for editing, as shown in the following screen:
There are two ways you can convert a Quote to a Sale:

listitem.para: Change the Sale Type from "Quote" to "Sale"
OR
Select the PAYMENT button, which automatically converts Quotes to Sales

section.title: Deleting Quotes
section.para: Many times Customers will change their minds about a purchase. If you ever need to delete a Quote prior to its expiration date, simply open the Cash Register screen and follow these steps:

listitem.para: Highlight the Quote you want to delete
Select the DELETE button
